components.description:
A bouquet of brightly colored flowers. Generally depicted as a collection of pink and yellow flowers with green stems tied together. Positioned at various angles across platforms.

Commonly used for Valentine’s Day, Mother’s Day, and other special occasions. May also be more generally used to express such sentiments as love, appreciation, and happiness.

Google’s flowers were previously all yellow, Microsoft’s roses, and Samsung’s pink and white.
components.title: Bouquet

description:
A bouquet of brightly colored flowers. Generally depicted as a collection of pink and yellow flowers with green stems tied together. Positioned at various angles across platforms.

Commonly used for Valentine’s Day, Mother’s Day, and other special occasions. May also be more generally used to express such sentiments as love, appreciation, and happiness.

Google’s flowers were previously all yellow, Microsoft’s roses, and Samsung’s pink and white.
title: Bouquet

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Romance symbols

emoji_net_data.name: bouquet

bn:00012432n: A nosegay, tussie-mussie, or posy is a small flower bouquet, typically given as a gift.
An arrangement of flowers that is usually given as a present
A small bunch of flowers typically given as a gift and often held together by a string around the flower stems.
A small bouquet of flowers worn at the shoulder or waist or on the wrist.
A flower; a bouquet; a nosegay.
A small bouquet of flowers, originally worn attached to the bodice of a woman's dress.
A corsage is a small bouquet of flowers worn on a woman's dress or worn around her wrist to a formal occasion, traditionally purchased by the woman's date.

bn:00073636n: ¬† Traditionally the first of the four seasons of the year in temperate regions, in which plants spring from the ground and trees come into blossom, following winter and preceding summer.
One of the four temperate seasons
The season of spring, between winter and summer.
Traditionally the first of the four seasons, the season of growth with an ever increasing amount of daytime.
Spring is one of the four conventional temperate seasons, following winter and preceding summer.
Spring is one of the four seasons of temperate zones, the transition from winter into summer.

bn:00035378n: The reproductive structure of angiosperm plants, consisting of stamens and carpels surrounded by petals and sepals all borne on the receptacle.
A flower lacking sepals, petals, stamens, or carpels.
Flowers, sometimes known as blooms or blossoms, are the reproductive structures found in flowering plants.
A flower, sometimes known as a bloom or blossom, is the reproductive structure found in flowering plants.
Structure found in some plants (division Magnoliophyta / angiosperms) to support reproduction
A plant cultivated for its blooms or blossoms
